tool.name: Count.groups
tool.description: counts the number of sequences represented by a specific group or set of groups
tool.command:
@SHELL_OPTIONS@
## create symlinks to input datasets ln -s '$group' group.dat && #if $groupnames.source == "accnos": ln -s '$groupnames.accnos' groupnames.accnos.dat && #end if
echo 'count.groups( #if $group.is_of_type("mothur.shared"): shared=group.dat #elif $group.is_of_type("mothur.count_table"): count=group.dat #else: group=group.dat #end if #if $groupnames.source == "groups": #if $groupnames.groups: ,groups=${ str($groupnames.groups).replace(",","-") } #end if #elif $groupnames.source == "accnos": #if $groupnames.accnos: ,accnos=groupnames.accnos.dat #end if #end if )' | sed 's/ //g' ## mothur trips over whitespace | mothur | tee mothur.out.log &&
## parse relevant tool output from logfile to file cat mothur.*.logfile | head -n-7 | sed '1,30d' > '$grp_count'

param.name: group
param.label: group, shared, or count_table - Group file for sequence count

param.name: source
param.label: Filter group names
param.option: A History Group Name Accnos Dataset

param.name: groups
param.label: groups - Pick groups to include
param.help: All groups displayed if none are selected.

param.name: accnos
param.label: accnos - Group Names from your history

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documentation**
The count.groups_ command counts sequences from a specific group or set of groups from a group_ or shared_ file.
.. _shared: https://www.mothur.org/wiki/Shared_file .. _group: https://www.mothur.org/wiki/Group_file .. _count.groups: https://www.mothur.org/wiki/Count.groups
